messages.content: What is the basic usage of the cg-image-picker node?

The basic usage is illustrated in a simple workflow that allows you to preview images and choose one or more to pass on to the rest of your workflow. The workflow consists of regular nodes and the Unified Chooser and is recommended as a starting point for trying the node. If there are any issues, it will be easier to narrow down the problems on this simple workflow.
What are the recent changes in the cg-image-picker up to version 2.10?

Recent changes include adding the `Repeat last selection` in version 2.10, `Progress first pick`, and fixing a few bugs in version 2.9. Version 2.8.2 introduced hotkeys and an alert sound, while version 2.8 added three new modes: pass through, take first n, take last n. Version 2.7 included various minor fixes, updated JS deployment, and added a setting to control the position of the HUD. In version 2.6, the Preview Chooser fabric was added, and several bug fixes and improvements were made.
What are the available modes for the cg-image-picker node?
The available modes include: Always pause, Repeat last selection, Only pause if batch, Progress first pick, Pass through, Take First n, and Take Last n. The last three are designed for special cases.
How can I install the cg-image-picker node?

You can find and install the cg-image-picker node in Comfy Manager. Alternatively, you can clone the repository from GitHub: `git clone https://github.com/chrisgoringe/cg-image-picker.git` into the `custom_nodes` directory of your ComfyUI installation.
How can I update the cg-image-picker node?

You can update the cg-image-picker node using the Comfy Manager. Alternatively, you can update it manually by navigating to the `cg-image-picker` directory in your ComfyUI's `custom_nodes` folder and running `git pull`.
